alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Nelson; Pembina; Ramsey; Steele; Traill; Western Walsh County (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:24AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grand Forks, eastern Nelson, northern Traill, northeastern Ramsey, Walsh, northern Steele and southwestern Pembina Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Edmore to Orr to near Cummings. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Orr, Forest River Colony and McCanna around 425 AM CDT. Inkster around 435 AM CDT. Cummings and Buxton around 440 AM CDT. Fairdale around 450 AM CDT. Gilby and Honeyford around 455 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Grand Forks Airport and American Crystal Sugar. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 106 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Nelson; Pembina; Ramsey; Steele; Traill; Western Walsh County
